ovdesc.p: This table defines, for each currency, interest rates for any time period desired by the user. These periods can be defined either in months, e.g. 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months etc.. or in days, e.g. 7 days, 15 days, 30 days etc.. For each period defined by the user, both a BID and OFFER rate can be entered.

PERIODIC.INTEREST will be used by applications such as Foreign Exchange to default interest rate on Forward contracts using the Interest revaluation method or the Loans and Deposits applications to perform automatic Rollover.

In LD contracts, where the INT.RATE.TYPE is set to PERIODIC.AUTOMATIC, on the R (rate revision) schedule dates, the PERIODIC.INTEREST table will be referred to, for the interest rate from the appropriate key (record). Changes can be made to keys which were created before current date, and contracts which have accessed these keys will also get updated with the changes, provided the R schedules were not prior to any principal or interest movements on the contract. Whenever a backvalued key in PERIODIC.INTEREST is changed, the ID of such key is stored in an internal file called PERIODIC.RATE.CHANGE.

By using local routines in this field, regional developers can add their own tables to T24 and return spreads and/or interest rates based upon decisions in their own routines. This field allows local routines to be called when this record is accessed by the TERMRATE routine.
Two parameters are passed to, and returned by, the local routine:
- INTEREST.RATE the derived Periodic interest rate - MARGIN which can be passed from the calling process
If more than one local routine is defined then each routine will be called in turn with the above parameters.
As an example, Money Market Auto Rollovers can use a routine to determine new rates and/or spreads based on locally developed spread tables related to department and customer groups.
See Helptext for Money Market ROLLOVER.INT.RATE.
Optional input. Multi Valued field up to 35 alphanumeric characters in length.
Any value(s) entered must be the name(s) of a uniVerse routine(s) that have been compiled and cataloged successfully.

Indicates the period to which a rate applies.

'R' for Remaining, NND for Rest period in Days where D = Number of Days, NNNM for Rest Period in Months where M= Number of Months and NNY for rest period in years where Y= Number of years. e.g. a 10 day rest period would be written as 10D, a 120 month rest period as 120M and a 20 year rest period as 20Y. R must be the last rest period entered. Multi value field. (Mandatory input. No default.)
The number of days or months must be entered in logical order i.e. in ascending sequence.
For days the range 01-31 will be allowed while for months 01-360 will be accepted. For years the range 01-30 is accepted.
When 'R' is defined, at least one additional rest period must be defined.
When more than one rest period is defined, 'R' must be entered on the last entered rest period.
